Description: Redware pottery jar with a shallow pointed off-set base, convex sides widening and becoming straight towards the angular shoulder with two handles(one missing), the neck has broken away, decorated with a red slip and overlain with painted friezes in black and red(now very worn).
Curator's comments: See Favard-Meeks in Brissaud and Zivie-Coche: Tanis 1987-1997 (1998) p.118.
Condition: incomplete - one handle and the neck are missing
